intro: Diplacus parryi, commonly known as the parry's monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has opposite, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Diplacus parryi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
